attributes.action: Bring Back Treason ,A Law needs to be passed to stop the disrespect our troops face
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to Acknowledge
     that the British public believe the Respect shown to the armed
     forces to be inadequate

     The Armed Forces of this country should be treated with
     respect. The refusal to serve Soldiers in Uniform in places
     such as petrol stations, public houses, clubs and the like is
     totally unacceptable and should stop forthwith. Our Serving men
     and women wear that Uniform with pride, and sacrifice much in
     the Service of their country - the least they deserve in return
     is to be treated with dignity and respect, and be allowed to go
     about their business in the same way as everyone else. Nobody
     has the right to stop them from entering a shop or public house
     because they are in uniform. That would not happen to a member
     of the Police Force or other uniformed organisations - and
     rightly so - therefore, it should not be allowed to happen to a
     Soldier. This country of ours should back our Troops and give
     them the respect and support they rightly deserve.It should also be an offence to slag off members of our Armed forces in Any way
